common.description:
Common configuration to all components. They will be overridden by component-specific configuration.
Any value defined in the component-specific settings will be merged with values defined in the common settings.

filters.description:
InfluxDB 3.0 logging verbosity can be configured in fine grained way using a list
of "log filters".

Each log filter is an expression in the form of:

target=level

Where "target" matches the "target" field in the logs, while level can be one of
error, warn, info, debug and trace.

Error and warn are less verbose while debug and trace are more verbose.

You can omit target and just specify a level. In that case the level 
will set the maximum level for all events that are not enabled by other filters.

If a filter for a given target appears again in the filter list, it will override
a previous occurrence. This allows you to override the default filters.

The full documentation for the log filter syntax can be found at:
https://docs.rs/tracing-subscriber/latest/tracing_subscriber/filter/struct.EnvFilter.html

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels

tolerations.description:
Pod tolerations to place onto this IOx component to affect scheduling decisions.

For further details, consult the Kubernetes documentation
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration

egress.description: Configuration for how external resources are accessed from Clustered components

customCertificates.description:
Custom certificate or CA Bundle. Used to verify outbound connections performed by influxdb, such as OIDC servers,
postgres databases, or object store API endpoints.

Equivalent to the SSL_CERT_FILE environment variable used by OpenSSL.

valueFrom.description: Allows to source the value from configMaps or secrets

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key from a ConfigMap.

key.description: The key to select.

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

optional.description: Specify whether the ConfigMap or it's key must be defined

featureFlags.description:
An array of feature flag names. Feature flags (aka feature gates) control features that
have not yet been released. They can be experimental to varying degrees (alpha, beta, rc).

grafana.description:
An experimental, minimal installation of a Grafana Deployment to use alongside Clustered.

Only this flag if you do not have your own metric visualisation setup and wish
to experiment with Clustered. It is tested with Grafana v10.3.4.

localTracing.description:
Experimental installation of Jaeger for tracing capabilities with InfluxDB 3.

Only enable this flag when instructed to do so by the support team.

noGrpcProbes.description: Remove gRPC liveness/readiness probes for debug service

noMinReadySeconds.description:
Experimental flag for Kubernetes clusters that are lower than v1.25.

No longer uses minReadySeconds for workloads, this will cause downtime.

noPrometheus.description:
Disable the install of the default bare-bones Prometheus StatefulSet installation alongside Clustered.

This feature flag is useful when you already have a monitoring setup and wish to utilise it.

NOTE: In future releases, the `debug-service` will have a partial, minor, dependency on a Prometheus instance being available.
If you do not wish for this service to utilise your own installation of Prometheus, disabling it here may cause issues.

serviceMonitor.description:
Deprecated. Use observability.serviceMonitor instead.

Create a ServiceMonitor resource for InfluxDB3.

hostingEnvironment.description: Environment or cloud-specific configuration elements which are utilised by InfluxDB Clustered.

eksRoleArn.description: IAM role ARN to apply to the IOx ServiceAccount, used with EKS IRSA.

gke.description: Configuration for hosting on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

workloadIdentity.description:
Authentication via GKE workload identity. This will annotate the relevant Kubernetes ServiceAccount objects.
See https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/workload-identity for further details.

serviceAccountEmail.description: Google IAM Service Account email, this should be in the format "NAME@PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com".

openshift.description: Configuration for hosting on Red Hat OpenShift.

images.description: Manipulate how images are retrieved for Clustered. This is typically useful for air-gapped environments when you need to use an internal registry.

overrides.description:
Override specific images using the contained predicate fields.

This takes precedence over the registryOverride field.

item.description: Remaps an image matching naming predicates

name.description:
Naming predicate: the part of the image name that comes after the registry name, e.g.
If the image name is "oci.influxdata.com/foo/bar:1234", the name field matches "foo/bar"

newFQIN.description:
Rewrite expression: when a naming predicate matches this image, rewrite the image reference
using this Fully Qualified Image Name. i.e. this replaces the whole registry/imagename:tag@digest
parts of the input image reference.

registryOverride.description:
Place a new registry prefix infront of all Clustered component images.

This is used when you wish to maintain the original registry path for images and simply relocate them underneath
your own registry.

Example:
registryOverride: 'newReg' means 'myregistry/test' becomes 'newReg/myregistry/test'

ingesterStorage.description: Storage configuration for the Clustered ingesters.

storage.description:
A higher value provides more disk space for the Write-Ahead Log (WAL) to each ingester, allowing for a greater set of leading edge data to be maintained in-memory.
This also reduces the frequency of WAL rotations, leading to better query performance and less burden on the compactor.

Note that at 90% capacity, an ingester will stop accepting writes in order to persist its active WAL into the configured object store as parquet files.

ingress.description: Configuration for how Clustered components are accessed.

grpc.description: Configuration for components which utilise gRPC

hosts.description: A number of hosts/domains to use as entrypoints within the Ingress resources.

http.description: Configuration for components which utilise HTTP

template.description:
Template to apply across configured Ingress-type resources.
This allows you to specify a range of third party annotations onto the created Ingress objects and/or
alter the kind of Ingress you would like to use, e.g. 'Route'.

selector.description:
This selector determines which Istio ingress gateway pods will be chosen
to handle traffic for the created Gateway resources. A blank selector means that all
gateway pods in the cluster will handle traffic.

For more details, see https://istio.io/latest/docs/reference/config/networking/gateway/#Gateway

annotations.description: Annotations to place onto the objects which enable ingress.

selector.description:
Selector to specify which gateway deployment utilises the configured ingress configuration.

Note that this is only for Istio Gateway, see https://istio.io/latest/docs/reference/config/networking/gateway/#Gateway for further details

tlsSecretName.description:
Kubernetes Secret name which contains TLS certificates.

If you are using cert-manager, this is the name of the Secret to create containing certificates.
Note that cert-manager is externally managed and is not apart of a Clustered configuration.

monitoringStorage.description: Storage configuration for the Prometheus instance shipped alongside Clustered for basic monitoring purposes.

storage.description: The amount of storage to provision for the attached volume, e.g. "2Gi".

objectStore.description: Configuration for the backing object store of IOx.

serviceAccountSecret.description:
Authentication via Google IAM Service Account credentials file using a Kubernetes Secret name and key.
See https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/tutorials/authenticating-to-cloud-platform for further details.

If you wish to use GKE IAM annotations, refer to the hostingEnviornment section of the schema.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.  Must be a valid secret key.

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

region.description: The region in which the bucket resides. This may not be required dependent on your object store provider.

s3.description: Configuration for AWS S3 (compatible) object stores.

observability.description: Configuration for gaining operational insight into Clustered components

serviceMonitor.description:
Configure a ServiceMonitor resource to easily expose InfluxDB metrics via the Prometheus Operator.
See the Prometheus Operator documentation for usage:
https://github.com/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator/blob/main/Documentation/user-guides/getting-started.md

interval.description: A duration string that controls the length of time between scrape attempts, ex: '15s', or '1m'

scrapeTimeout.description: A duration string that controls the scrape timeout duration, ex: '10s'

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed.

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required.

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed.

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required.
